questions.question: Which CSS Grid property is used to define the size of columns in a grid layout?
options: grid-column-size
grid-template-columns
grid-columns
column-template
questions.explanation: grid-template-columns defines the columns of the grid with a space-separated list of values representing the size of each column. For example: grid-template-columns: 1fr 2fr 1fr;

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CSS property 'flex: 1'?
options: It makes the element flexible
It sets the element's flex-grow to 1, allowing it to grow and fill available space
It creates a one-column flex container
It sets the element's order in flexbox to 1
questions.correctAnswer: It sets the element's flex-grow to 1, allowing it to grow and fill available space
questions.explanation: flex: 1 is shorthand for flex: 1 1 0%. It sets flex-grow: 1, flex-shrink: 1, and flex-basis: 0%, making the element grow to fill available space while maintaining equal widths with other flex: 1 elements.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the :root pseudo-class in CSS?
options: To select the first element in the document
To select the body element
To select the highest-level parent in the DOM
To select the html element and define custom properties
questions.correctAnswer: To select the html element and define custom properties
questions.explanation: :root represents the html element and is commonly used to declare CSS custom properties (variables). It has a higher specificity than the html selector.

questions.question: Which CSS function is used to create a smooth transition between colors in a background?
options: transition()
linear-gradient()
color-mix()
blend()
questions.explanation: linear-gradient() creates a smooth transition between two or more colors along a straight line. For example: background: linear-gradient(to right, red, blue);

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CSS clamp() function?
options: To restrict a value to a specific range
To clamp elements to their parent container
To fix elements in place while scrolling
To round numbers to the nearest integer
questions.correctAnswer: To restrict a value to a specific range
questions.explanation: clamp() takes three parameters: minimum value, preferred value, and maximum value. It ensures a property stays within a range while allowing it to scale between the bounds. Example: font-size: clamp(1rem, 2.5vw, 2rem);
